data.title: Love to Read
data.text: This Library has a lot to offer. It has all kinds of things like a Geneology room to find out your lineage. A great place to take the children.

data.title: great children's section
data.text: Love that it has a coffee shop!  Impressed with the collections, friendly staff, location, ease of accessibility.  Lovely place to spend time with family.

data.title: Free wifi and games for the kids
data.text: Great for a rainy day. Kids were able to play chess on a board with two foot tall chess pieces. I used the free wifi to book a hotel. There was also a scavenger hunt for the kids, and other toys and games for them to play with.

data.title: A Great Place of Knowledge
data.text: The Laramie County Public Library is a really great place for a smaller town!  From forward looking environmental care (received an award from the US Green Building Council) in their stucture, to technology upgrades, learning facilities, community participation and more!  And for those of us who still like the 'old fashioned hard cover or paperback books', they have a great selection to choose from.  And they have 'The Library Cafe' for your enjoyment while there.  There is a lot of community information available and the staff is really helpful.  I believe it to be one of the best smaller town libraries in the US!

data.title: Love This Library
data.text: This is a great library. There are so many options: fiction, non-fiction, children's, teen's, magazines, movies, TV Shows and even CDs. There are three open floors that don't feel cramped in any way. The children's section is on the second floor and it is so much fun, they even have play rooms. There are private study rooms on the third floor and a computer lab. There is also a quiet room on the third floor that has a nice fireplace and view of the city! The only down side I would say is you have to pay $2.00 to rent a movie/TV show and it is only for a couple days. I am not used to having to pay for movies at a library, but in their defense they do have a large selection of new shows. You also have to pay a $2.00 fee if you request a book from a different library. Other than that, it is a great place!

data.title: one of the top libraries in the country
data.text:
What a pleasant place to spend an afternoon. Not your regular library - this one is well equipped with computers, a great variety of books, new books in every time we visit, a play place for the children, a teen meeting place, rooms to rent for personal use, monthly program list of all the activities for the month, and much more. 
 Grab a cup of coffee from the library cafe, find your favorite author, and enjoy a couple hours of "solitude" in one of the several easy chairs.

data.title: Great place to spend an afternoon
data.text:
This library is so much more than books. And the books are great. The staff is super helpful. An the floor for kids is awesome. Lots of learning games.
  There are plenty of quiet nooks to curl up with a book. There's even a computer room, with more than enough computers.

data.title: Best Library Ever...
data.text: This Library is really excellent. We come here often. They have an excellent book selection and the kids floor/area is amazing! All of the staff are knowledgeable and kind.

data.title: Fantastic Resource
data.text: Three floors of wonder, excellent place to be and research. Private rooms for study, computers, a teen zone, just a wonder

data.title: Favorite library so far.
data.text: I loved living in Cheyenne for this library alone. They are efficient and have a vast selection. They have upgraded technology with self check outs and returns. Their computers run smoothly. They have a small children's play area that is fun for little ones.

data.title: Great geneology reference library
data.text: Many valuable resources are housed in this library and staff is available for assistance.  City directories, phone books, etc.

data.title: Amazing facility
data.text: I'm so proud of our Laramie County Public Library.  It is designed well, has lots of meeting rooms and even a great coffee shop.  The architecture is fun and interesting.

data.title: Beautifully Designed
data.text:
I'm a book lover so this review will be slanted of course. When they built this library the town questioned why we needed such a huge building but they've put all the "extra" room to very good use.
Not only do I enjoy browsing the vast selection of books, I've also attended many seminars that take place at the Library.

data.title: Nice library
data.text: For Cheyenne,this is a nice library. Good for all ages,even has a nice small coffee shop. Would recommend.

data.title: Locals secret trove of love
data.text: The locals pride and a great second floor for the kids, included video game console and games. No only do We enjoy this floor and the sponsored activity's via: (home depo. for Christmas.) The social bias is noticeable and the sooner you get to know the older females the better. We love the chess classes, the NASA exhibit, the coffee shop.

data.title: Very nice and modern!
data.text: This library won national library of the year in 2007 and a few other second and third place awards.  You can rent books, movies, games, and music.  Use computers for free, and other stuff.

data.title: Fancy
data.text: Employees everywhere to help, great selections, and fancy design.  Located near downtown, this is a wonderful library. Checked out 2 movies cost $4.

data.title: Good Place to Relax
data.text: Went to visit the library during a recent stopover in Cheyenne. Friendly staff, good book selection, FAST WIFI. Best library I have been to in a long time.

data.title: One of the best in the country!
data.text:
This library has one countless awards around the country!  The staff are always very helpful and very knowledgeable.  After not using the county library in years I went in and got my membership card for the first time!  They have plenty of activities throughout the month and are very supportive of clubs and youth activities.  

Perfect place to take the little ones to get some time with others in a safe, educational, and fun environment.

data.title: Wonderful experience.
data.text:
I am first impressed by the buildings spaciousness, organization, and lighting. The help desks are convenient and the staff is knowledgable. The offer of meeting and study rooms, as well as the large computer lab, are a bonus and an entire separate floor dedicated to children and youth ( including computer stations) is marvelous. The extensive genealogy department is one one the most complete I have had the privilege to use. 
What a jewel this library is for the city.
